definitions: manage or cope with a difficult situation or problem effectively
give out playing cards to players in a card game
engage in commercial transactions or negotiate business agreements
examples: She knows how to deal with difficult customers professionally
Parents must deal with many challenges while raising children
It's your turn to deal the cards for this round
The dealer will deal seven cards to each player
Our company deals with suppliers from around the world
They deal in antique furniture and rare collectibles

definitions: become or cause something to become greater in size amount intensity or degree
examples: Sales increased by twenty percent during the holiday season
Exercise can increase your energy levels throughout the day

definitions: move something to cover an opening or prevent access to something
bring something to an end or reach the final stage
reduce the distance between oneself and something or someone else
examples: Please close the door quietly when you leave the room
The shop closes at nine o'clock every evening
Let's close the meeting with a summary of key points
The company will close the deal by next Friday
The gap between the two runners closed in the final lap
She closed the distance between them with quick steps

definitions: be in or assume a horizontal or resting position on a surface
deliberately say something that is not true to deceive someone
be located or situated in a particular place or position
examples: I need to lie down after that exhausting workout session
The cat likes to lie in the sunny spot by the window
He lied about his age to get into the nightclub
Never lie to your doctor about your medical history
The small town lies between two mountain ranges
The responsibility lies with the project manager

definitions: produce a picture or diagram by making lines and marks on paper
cause something to move in a particular direction by pulling or attracting
take or pull something out from a place where it is kept
examples: She loves to draw portraits of her family members
Can you draw a map showing how to get there
The concert drew thousands of fans from neighboring cities
Her speech drew attention to important environmental issues
Draw water from the well using the bucket and rope
He drew a knife from his pocket during the confrontation

definitions: decide on and arrange the details of something in advance systematically
have the intention or desire to do something in the future
examples: We need to plan the wedding at least six months ahead
The architects planned every detail of the new building carefully
I plan to visit my grandmother next weekend
They plan to expand their business into new markets

definitions: fall or cause something to fall vertically from a higher position
become lower in amount level or value over a period of time
stop doing or planning something or end a relationship suddenly
examples: Be careful not to drop the glass vase on the floor
Rain drops fell steadily throughout the entire afternoon
Temperature will drop below freezing tonight according to forecasts
Stock prices dropped sharply after the announcement
She decided to drop the course because it was too difficult
Let's drop this subject and talk about something else

definitions: exert force on something to move it away from oneself or origin
try hard to persuade or promote something with determination and energy
come close to or go beyond an acceptable limit or boundary
examples: Push the door firmly to make sure it closes properly
She pushed the shopping cart through the crowded store aisles
The company will push their new product through aggressive marketing
Parents shouldn't push their children too hard academically
Don't push your luck by arriving late to work again
He's pushing sixty but still runs marathons regularly

definitions: desire to know something or feel curious about something unknown or unexplained
feel admiration and amazement caused by something beautiful unexpected or unfamiliar
examples: I wonder what happened to my old school friends
Scientists wonder if there's life on other planets
Tourists wonder at the beauty of the ancient architecture
Children wonder at the magic tricks during the show

definitions: have or include something as a necessary part or result of something
cause someone to participate in an activity or situation often emotionally
examples: This project involves working with teams from different countries
The recipe involves mixing several unusual ingredients together
Don't involve me in your personal disputes with coworkers
The accident involved three cars and two motorcycles

definitions: take delight or pleasure in an activity or experience something with satisfaction
examples: We really enjoyed the concert last night at the stadium
She enjoys reading mystery novels before going to bed

definitions: attempt to find or discover by searching or questioning systematically
try to obtain or achieve something through effort or request
examples: Police are seeking witnesses to the accident yesterday afternoon
Many people seek happiness in material possessions
Students often seek advice from their professors about careers
The company seeks qualified candidates for the management position

definitions: keep someone or something safe from injury damage or loss through preventive measures
examples: Parents naturally want to protect their children from danger
Sunscreen helps protect your skin from harmful UV rays

definitions: be a sign or symbol of something or embody a particular quality
act or speak officially for someone or be chosen to do this
examples: The dove represents peace in many cultures around the world
These statistics represent only a small portion of total sales
She will represent our company at the international conference
A lawyer represents their client's interests in court

definitions: put something into a space or container until no more can be added
take up all the available space time or capacity of something
examples: Please fill the water bottles before we start hiking
The room quickly filled with smoke from the fire
Her busy schedule fills every hour of the day
Music filled the air during the summer festival

definitions: express something clearly and definitely in speech or writing
specify something exactly or formally in official or legal contexts
examples: Please state your name and address for the record
The professor stated the main points of her argument clearly
The contract states all terms and conditions of employment
The law states that seat belts must be worn

definitions: put something in a particular position or location carefully or deliberately
achieve a particular position in a race or competition ranking
examples: Place the books back on the shelf when you're finished
She carefully placed the vase on the mantelpiece
Our team placed third in the regional championships
The horse placed second in yesterday's race

definitions: be unsuccessful in achieving one's goal or passing a test
cease to work properly or break down when needed most
neglect to do something expected or required by obligation
examples: Many students fail their driving test on the first attempt
The business failed after only six months of operation
The engine failed just as we reached the highway
My computer failed during an important presentation
Don't fail to lock the door when you leave
He failed to mention the change in schedule

definitions: indicate a choice or opinion in an election or meeting by official means
examples: Citizens vote for their representatives every four years
All members must vote on the proposed changes

definitions: examine two or more things to identify similarities and differences between them
examples: Let's compare prices before making a purchase decision
Teachers often compare students' work to assess progress

definitions: recognize or establish who or what someone or something is through examination
examples: Can you identify the person in this photograph
Scientists identified a new species of butterfly

definitions: make something smaller or less in amount degree or size through deliberate action
examples: We need to reduce expenses to balance the budget
Exercise helps reduce stress and improve mental health

definitions: take action or do something for a particular purpose or reason
perform a fictional role in a play film or television production
behave in a particular way or manner in a given situation
examples: We must act quickly to prevent further damage
The government will act on the committee's recommendations
She acts in local theater productions every summer
He acted the part of Romeo brilliantly
Stop acting like a child and take responsibility
The medicine acts within minutes of taking it

definitions: feel troubled or anxious about actual or potential problems persistently
make someone feel anxious or troubled about actual or potential problems
examples: Parents worry about their children's safety at school
Don't worry about making mistakes while learning
The economic news worries investors about future growth
It worries me that she hasn't called yet

definitions: consent to receive or undertake something offered with willingness
believe or come to recognize something as valid or correct
examples: She accepted the job offer after careful consideration
The restaurant accepts credit cards and mobile payments
Scientists accept the theory based on extensive evidence
You must accept responsibility for your actions

definitions: come or go into a place building or room from outside
type or record information into a computer system or document
begin to be involved in or start a particular activity or state
examples: Please enter through the main door of the building
Students must enter the classroom before the bell rings
Enter your password to access your email account
She entered all the data into the spreadsheet
Many companies want to enter the renewable energy market
The country entered a period of economic growth

definitions: refer to something or someone briefly and without going into detail
examples: She mentioned your name during our conversation yesterday
The report mentions several possible solutions to the problem

definitions: feel or express a strong desire or hope for something unlikely
express a hope that someone will have good fortune or happiness
examples: I wish I could travel around the world someday
Children often wish for toys on their birthdays
We wish you a happy and prosperous new year
I wish you luck in your new job

definitions: discover the facts about something or calculate something exactly through investigation
be the decisive factor in causing something to happen in a particular way
make a firm decision about something after consideration of options
examples: Scientists determine the age of fossils using carbon dating
The investigation will determine the cause of the accident
Weather conditions will determine if the game proceeds tomorrow
Your attitude determines your success in life
She determined to finish her degree despite the challenges
We have determined that changes are necessary

definitions: state or assert that something is true without providing evidence immediately
demand or request something because you believe you have a right to it
examples: He claims to have seen the accident happen
The company claims their product is the best available
You can claim compensation for delayed flights
She claimed her inheritance after her uncle's death

definitions: say or write something to deal with or as a reaction to a question
react to a signal such as a telephone ringing or doorbell
examples: Please answer all questions honestly on the application form
The student answered the teacher's question correctly
Can someone answer the phone while I'm in the meeting
No one answered when I knocked on the door

definitions: demonstrate the truth or existence of something by evidence or argument
turn out to be the case or have a particular result or quality
examples: The lawyer must prove her client's innocence in court
These documents prove that the payment was made
The new method proved to be more efficient than expected
Time will prove whether our decision was correct

definitions: attach or suspend something from above so it is supported from the top
be suspended or remain in position from a fixed point above
spend time relaxing or being somewhere without any particular purpose
examples: Hang your coat on the hook by the door
We need to hang the pictures before the guests arrive
The painting hangs crooked on the living room wall
Clouds hang low over the mountain peaks
Teenagers like to hang at the mall on weekends
Let's hang out at the coffee shop after work

definitions: exchange diverging or opposing views typically in a heated or angry way
give reasons or cite evidence in support of an idea or theory
examples: The siblings argue about everything from politics to sports
Don't argue with the referee's decision during the game
The lawyer will argue that her client acted in self-defense
Scientists argue that climate change requires immediate action

definitions: happen or take place especially without being planned or expected
exist or be found to be present in a place or under conditions
examples: The accident occurred at the intersection during rush hour
These events occurred before anyone could prevent them
This species occurs naturally in tropical rainforests
Similar problems occur in many developing countries

definitions: form a mental image or concept of something not actually present
suppose or assume something to be the case without actual proof
examples: Close your eyes and imagine a peaceful beach scene
Children imagine themselves as superheroes during play
I imagine you must be tired after your long journey
Can you imagine what life was like centuries ago

definitions: give something to someone formally or ceremonially as a gift or award
show or display something for others to see or consider officially
formally introduce someone to another person or to an audience
examples: The principal will present awards at the graduation ceremony
She presented him with a watch for his retirement
The team will present their findings at tomorrow's meeting
The museum presents a new exhibition every month
May I present our new chief executive officer
The host presented the speakers to the audience

definitions: calculate or work out an amount or value using mathematics or logic
understand or determine something after thinking about it carefully
examples: Can you figure the total cost including tax and shipping
I need to figure how much paint we'll need
It took me hours to figure out the puzzle
She couldn't figure why he was acting so strangely

definitions: make sounds and movements of the face and body expressing amusement or joy
examples: The audience laughed at the comedian's jokes all evening
We couldn't help but laugh at the funny video

definitions: talk or write about a topic in detail considering different aspects and opinions
examples: Let's discuss the proposal in tomorrow's meeting
The book discusses various theories of human behavior

definitions: bring a task or activity to an end by completing it successfully
consume all of something especially food or drink leaving nothing
examples: She needs to finish her homework before watching television
The marathon runner finished the race in under three hours
Please finish your vegetables before you leave the table
He finished the entire pizza by himself

definitions: identify someone or something from having encountered them before or from knowledge
acknowledge the existence validity or legality of something formally or officially
examples: I didn't recognize her with her new haircut
The software can recognize faces in photographs
The government refuses to recognize the new regime
We must recognize her contributions to the project

definitions: make a formal request or application for something like a job or permit
put something into operation or practical use in a particular situation
be applicable or relevant to a particular person or situation
examples: She decided to apply for the scholarship program
You must apply for a visa before traveling
Apply pressure to stop the bleeding immediately
We need to apply these principles in practice
These rules apply to all employees equally
The discount doesn't apply to sale items

definitions: make something or someone ready for use or consideration in advance
make food ready for eating by combining heating or arranging ingredients
examples: Students should prepare for exams weeks in advance
The team must prepare a presentation for the client
She prepares dinner for her family every evening
The chef prepares meals using fresh local ingredients

definitions: give a name to someone or something to identify them distinctly
identify or mention someone or something by their name specifically
examples: They decided to name their daughter after her grandmother
The company will name the new product next month
Can you name all the planets in our solar system
The witness refused to name the suspects involved

definitions: move from a lower position to a higher one vertically or upward
increase in number amount or intensity over a period of time
get up from lying sitting or kneeling to a standing position
examples: The sun rises in the east every morning
Smoke rises from the chimney on cold winter days
Prices continue to rise due to increased demand
The temperature will rise throughout the afternoon
She rises early to practice yoga before work
Everyone must rise when the judge enters court

definitions: make someone do something against their will using pressure or threats
use physical strength or power to move or affect something
examples: You cannot force people to change their beliefs
The new law will force companies to reduce emissions
Strong winds forced the door open during the storm
They had to force the lock when they lost the key

definitions: write one's name on something to authorize or authenticate it officially
communicate using gestures especially in a formal sign language system
be an indication or evidence of a particular situation or quality
examples: Please sign your name at the bottom of the form
Both parties must sign the contract before it's valid
She learned to sign so she could communicate with deaf students
The interpreter will sign during the presentation
Dark clouds sign that rain is coming soon
These symptoms sign a serious medical condition

definitions: cause physical pain or injury to someone or part of the body
feel physical pain in a part of one's body continuously or intermittently
cause emotional pain distress or damage to someone's feelings
examples: Be careful with that knife or you'll hurt yourself
The fall hurt his knee quite badly
My back hurts after sitting at the desk all day
Does your tooth still hurt from the procedure
His harsh words really hurt her feelings
It hurts to see them struggle financially

definitions: put something down gently or carefully in a horizontal position
prepare or position something for a particular purpose or use
produce an egg or eggs from the body as birds and reptiles do
examples: Lay the baby gently in the crib for naptime
Workers lay bricks to build the garden wall
They need to lay the foundation before building begins
Let's lay the table for dinner guests
Chickens lay eggs almost daily during summer months
The turtle will lay her eggs in the sand
